revision.comment: Removing [[:c:File:YouCaring_Logo.svg|YouCaring_Logo.svg]], it has been deleted from Commons by [[:c:User:Jcb|Jcb]] because: [[:c:COM:OTRS|No permission]] since 18 November 2018.
revision.text:
{{Infobox website | name = YouCaring | logo = | url = {{url|youcaring.com/}} | commercial = Yes | type = [[Crowdfunding]] | language = English | launch date = 2011 | location_city = San Francisco, CA | location_country = [[US]] | founder = Brock Ketcher, Naomi Ketcher, Luke Miner }}
'''YouCaring''' is a crowdfunding website for personal, medical, and charitable causes. The company is a [[B Corporation (certification)|Certified B corporation]] based in San Francisco, California.<ref>{{cite web|title=Certified B Corporation: YouCaring|url=https://www.bcorporation.net/community/youcaringcom|website=B Corporation Listing|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref> YouCaring does not take a percentage of funds raised on its site, or charge those raising funds a fee (any fees associated with third-party credit card processors such as [[PayPal]] are paid by donors).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aarp.org/health/health-insurance/info-06-2012/crowdfunding-for-health-care.html|title=Crowdfunding to Pay Medical Bills and Expenses - Health Care - AARP|first=Kayleigh|last=Kulp|publisher=|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxbusiness.com/personal-finance/2012/04/27/how-to-use-crowdfunding-to-cover-health-care-bills/|title=How to Use Crowdfunding to Cover Health-Care Bills|first=Kayleigh|last=Kulp|date=27 April 2012|publisher=|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.npr.org/news/front/163489063|title=The Sick Turn To Crowd Funding To Pay Medical Bills|publisher=|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref>The company relies on voluntary donations from donors to fund operations.<ref name="Jain" /> YouCaring was acquired by [[GoFundMe]] in 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://blog.gofundme.com/gofundme-acquires-youcaring-cb9e5b90f40f|title=GoFundMe Acquires YouCaring – Giving Matters: Notes From GoFundMe|date=2018-04-03|work=Giving Matters: Notes From GoFundMe|access-date=2018-04-09}}</ref>
==History== YouCaring was founded in 2011 by Brock Ketcher, Naomi Ketcher, and Luke Miner. After returning from two years of international mission trips, the three friends wanted to continue to give back.<ref name="Jain">{{cite web|last1=Jain|first1=Chet|title=These Free Crowdfunding Platforms Are Making Lives Easy for Fundraisers|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/293337|website=Entrepreneur India|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref> They created a free crowdfunding website so people could raise money to overcome hardship.<ref name="Jain" /> To date, YouCaring has raised over $800 million from more than 8 million donors.<ref name="Woodley">{{cite web|last1=Woodley|first1=Suzanne|title=American Health Care Tragedies Are Taking Over Crowdfunding|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-06-12/america-s-health-care-crisis-is-a-gold-mine-for-crowdfunding|website=Bloomberg|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref> In March 2017, YouCaring acquired GiveForward.<ref name="Graham">{{cite web|last1=Graham|first1=Megan|title=Competitor acquires Chicago-based crowdfunding site GiveForward|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/bluesky/originals/ct-giveforward-youcaring-acquisition-bsi-20170329-story.html|website=Chicago Tribune|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Woodley" /> In May 2016, YouCaring became a [[B corporation|Certified B Corporation]].<ref name="Hurst">{{cite web|last1=Hurst|first1=Samantha|title=Brief: YouCaring Becomes Certified B Corporation|url=https://www.crowdfundinsider.com/2016/07/87627-youcaring-milestone-becoming-b-corporation/|website=Crowdfund Insider|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref> Each year, YouCaring releases internal fundraising data to show which cities in America are (by their own estimation) the most compassionate.<ref name="Hurst" />
==Business model== YouCaring users create crowdfunding campaigns to raise money for personal, medical, and charitable causes. Nearly 50% of the money raised on YouCaring is for medical expenses.<ref name="Ramsey">{{cite web|last1=Ramsey|first1=Lydia|title=Almost Half of all Money Raised Through Crowdfunding is Going Toward Medical Expenses|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/crowdfunding-for-medical-expenses-2017-6|website=Business Insider|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Woodley" /> Users write an explanation of their needs, set the amount they need to raise, upload supporting photos and video, and share their fundraisers through social channels and email. Donations can be made using credit card processors PayPal, WePay, or Stripe. YouCaring trademarked the name Compassionate Crowdfunding to describe its service. YouCaring doesn’t charge a fee to those raising funds, but a third-party credit card processing fee exists. Operating costs (including salaries for YouCaring employees) are funded by voluntary donations.<ref name="Jain" />
==Fee structure== YouCaring does not charge the fundraiser a fee, but YouCaring does ask that the donor provide a "Tip" to YouCaring.<ref name="Jain" /> The credit card processing fee for each donation is 2.9% plus $0.30 per donation, which is paid by the donor.<ref name="Serena">{{cite web|last1=Serena|first1=Katie|title=Crowdfunding Sites Are Making Lots of Money Off America’s Miserable Health Care System|url=http://www.salon.com/2017/06/13/crowdfunding-sites-are-making-lots-of-money-off-americas-miserable-health-care-system/|website=Salon|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Jain" /> All [[Comparison of crowdfunding services|crowdfunding platforms]] charge money either through the tipping fee structure that YouCaring charges or through a straight percentage which the fundraiser pays on the total amount raised.
==Controversy== Many journalists have pointed to crowdfunding for medical expenses as evidence for the failings of for-profit healthcare in the US and elsewhere.<ref name="Woodley" /> Some of that criticism has also been extended to crowdfunding sites.<ref name="Serena">{{cite web|last1=Serena|first1=Katie|title=Crowdfunding Sites Are Making Lots of Money Off America’s Miserable Health Care System|url=http://www.salon.com/2017/06/13/crowdfunding-sites-are-making-lots-of-money-off-americas-miserable-health-care-system/|website=Salon|accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="O’Neil">{{cite web|last1=O’Neil|first1=Luke|title=Go Viral or Die Trying|url=http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a54132/go-viral-or-die-trying/|website=Esquire|publisher=Hearst|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref>
==Notable fundraisers== <!-- do not update with an image of your active fundraiser! --> [[File:YouCaring_screenshot_2017.png|thumb|A fundraiser via YouCaring in 2017.]] *Help Save Matthew! – Aidez-nous à sauver Matthew!. Matthew Schreindorfer was diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia shortly after his wedding. Matthew and his wife Katie raised $700k so Matthew could participate in a clinical trial.<ref name="Fidelman">{{cite news|last1=Fidelman|first1=Charlie|title=Man With Rare Blood Cancer Gets Bone Marrow Transplant in Montreal|url=http://montrealgazette.com/news/local-news/matthew-schreindorfer-suffering-from-rare-blood-cancer-gets-bone-marrow-transplant-in-montreal|accessdate=30 July 2017|publisher=Montreal Gazette|date=June 1, 2015}}</ref> *The Ridley Sandler Memorial Foundation, Inc. After their daughter's death, Riley's parents started the Riley's Way Foundation to help her joyful spirit and compassionate nature live on. Their community raised $560,000 to honor Riley and help children facing major obstacles reach their full potential.<ref name="Gordon">{{cite web|last1=Gordon|first1=Amanda|title=Financiers Schooled in Empathy Over Barbecue at Riley's Way Gala|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-03-17/financiers-schooled-in-empathy-over-barbecue-at-riley-s-way-gala|website=Bloomberg|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref> *Fire Relief, Recovery, and Resiliency Fund for Oakland Fire. Following the tragic Oakland Ghost Ship fire that took 36 lives in December 2016, the Oakland, CA nonprofit Gray Area Foundation for the Arts started a fundraiser for a relief fund. The foundation raised $924,820 to support the more than 300 people affected by the tragedy.<ref name="Adamczyk">{{cite news|last1=Adamczyk|first1=Alicia|title=How to Help the Oakland Warehouse Fire Victims|url=http://time.com/money/4590388/help-oakland-warehouse-fire-victims/|accessdate=30 July 2017|publisher=Time|date=December 6, 2016}}</ref><ref name="Cameron">{{cite web|last1=Cameron|first1=Katrina|title=Oakland Fire Victims: How to Help|url=http://www.eastbaytimes.com/2016/12/06/oakland-fire-alameda-county-sets-up-disaster-relief-fund-to-help-victims/|website=East Bay Times|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Gaillot">{{cite web|last1=Gaillot|first1=Ann-Derrick|title=How to Donate to Oakland 'Ghost Ship' Fire Victims & Their Families During This Heartbreaking Time|url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/198335-how-to-donate-to-oakland-ghost-ship-fire-victims-their-families-during-this-heartbreaking-time|website=Bustle|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref> *Oakland Fire Relief. The Oakland A's baseball team started a relief fund on YouCaring in response to the Oakland Ghost Ship fire. Together with local sports teams the Golden State Warriors and Oakland Raiders, the A's donated a total of $150,000. Sutter Health also pledged $75,000. The fundraiser raised a total of $555,747.<ref name="Gaillot" /> *Heat for the Sisters. When a 150-year-old convent needed major heating repairs, its nuns turned to crowdfunding. More than 1,500 donors helped raise $160,686 to buy four new boilers, repair the chapel, and fix a leak into their Records and Archive Rooms.<ref name="ABC 7">{{cite news|last1=ABC 7|first1=Eyewitness News|title=Franciscan Sisters in Peekskill Will Get New Boilers for Convent Thanks to Donors|url=http://abc7ny.com/religion/update-franciscan-sisters-in-peekskill-will-get-new-boilers-for-convent-thanks-to-donors/1615070/|accessdate=30 July 2017|date=November 18, 2016}}</ref> *Restore WA Soldiers Home Cemetery – Orting. A patriotic family decided to help restore the Washington State Soldiers Home Cemetery in Orting. The family raised $254,109 on YouCaring and rallied volunteers to complete the project. * Help We Are Messengers replace their vehicle. The band We Are Messengers were in a serious car accident that destroyed their vehicle and tour equipment. Band members used crowdfunding to purchase a new tour van and necessary music equipment, raising a total of $77,542.<ref name="Law">{{cite web|last1=Law|first1=Jeannie|title=Christian band 'We Are Messengers' Involved in Fatal Tour Bus Accident|url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/christian-band-we-are-messengers-involved-in-fatal-tour-bus-accident-video-178842/|website=The Christian Post|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref> * Girls who survived Portland's MAX Attack. Three strangers stepped in to defend two young girls from racial slurs on the Portland, OR MAX train. Sadly, two men were killed and the other was wounded for standing up to hate speech. A crowdfunding campaign was created to help the girls heal from this trauma. The surviving defender posted a Facebook Live video that went viral, urging people to support the young girls through the YouCaring fundraiser, which raised $148,675 for basic necessities and mental health services.<ref name="Ellis">{{cite news|last1=Ellis|first1=Ralph|title=Portland attack survivor says people should support 'those little girls|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/31/us/portland-train-stabbing/index.html|accessdate=30 July 2017|publisher=CNN|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref><ref name="Domonoske">{{cite news|last1=Domonoske|first1=Camila|title=After Appeal By Portland Survivor, More Donations For The Girls He Defended|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/02/531218958/after-appeal-by-portland-survivor-more-donations-for-the-girls-he-defended|accessdate=30 July 2017|publisher=NPR|date=June 2, 2017}}</ref> * Help Kati defeat Ehlers-Danlos medical expenses! Kati McFarland is a college student who suffers from Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia, Gastroparesis, and Mast Cell Activation Disorder. She is raising funds to help pay for her extensive medical expenses. McFarland confronted Arkansas senator Tom Cotton about the need for the Affordable Care Act (ACA) at a town hall meeting; her story was picked up on CNN and other news sources.<ref name="O'Neil">{{cite web|last1=O'Neil|first1=Luke|title=Go Viral or Die Trying|url=http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a54132/go-viral-or-die-trying/|website=Esquire|publisher=Hearst|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Peterson">{{cite web|last1=Peterson|first1=Anne Helen|title=The Real Peril Of Crowdfunding Health Care”|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/annehelenpetersen/real-peril-of-crowdfunding-healthcare|website=Buzzfeed|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref> * #LiveLikeSusie Memorial Fund for Lung Cancer Research. Adam Klein, winner of reality show [[Survivor: Millennials vs. Gen X]], created a fundraiser on YouCaring for lung cancer research to honor his late mother.<ref name="Dugan">{{cite web|last1=Dugan|first1=Christina|title=Survivor's Adam Klein's Mother Died Two Days After the Show Ended|url=http://people.com/tv/survivor-adam-klein-mother-died-two-days-after-show-ended/|website=People|accessdate=30 July 2017}}</ref> *Musical group [[Doomtree]] created a YouCaring campaign for rapper [[P.O.S]] to help cover the secondary costs associated with a kidney transplant.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.time.com/2012/11/01/musician-health-care-crisis-rapper-p-o-s-crowdfunds-new-kidney/|title=Musician Health Care Crisis: Rapper P.O.S. Crowdfunds New Kidney|first=Lily|last=Rothman|publisher=|accessdate=23 May 2017|via=entertainment.time.com}}</ref> *[[Dickon Edwards]], former lead singer of [[Fosca]] and guitarist/lyricist for [[Orlando (band)|Orlando]] used the site to help raise money for funeral costs for his brother Tom, guitarist for [[Adam Ant]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youcaring.com/tomedwardssfamily-749358|title=Click here to support The Tom Edwards Memorial Fund|website=YouCaring|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref> *Science fiction author [[Jay Lake]] used the website to pay for [[whole genome sequencing]], towards the "small possibility that the results of such a test...may suggest a treatment path"<ref name="youcare"/> for his [[colon cancer]], which since 2008 has "progressed from a single tumor to [[metastasis|metastatic disease]] affecting the lung and liver, recurring after multiple surgeries and chemotherapy courses."<ref name="youcare">{{cite web| title= Sequence a Science Fiction Writer| url= http://www.youcaring.com/medical-fundraiser/Sequence-a-Science-Fiction-Writer/38705 | publisher= YouCaring |accessdate=2013-01-21}}</ref> After his successful campaign, Lake publicly criticized [[Paypal]] for the terms and processes the company uses when it thinks there's a fraud risk.<ref name="cnnmoney">{{cite web| url= http://money.cnn.com/2013/01/21/technology/paypal-frozen-funds| title= PayPal: 'Aggressive changes' coming to frozen funds policy| date= January 21, 2013 | first= Julianne |last=Pepitone | publisher= [[CNNMoney.com]]| accessdate=2013-01-21}}</ref> His experience was cited in news coverage over PayPal's public promise to introduce "aggressive changes" to its [[frozen funds]] policy.<ref name="cnnmoney"/> *Houston Flood Relief Fund. [[Hurricane Harvey]] severely damaged many homes and personal belongings, and caused large amounts of damage to Texas and Louisiana. This fundraiser is for all of the victims of this storm. As of September 1, 2017, the goal has been raised multiple times after surpassing each prior one, and is currently at $20,000,000. Many celebrities and organizations have partaken in this campaign, such as [[Drake (musician)|Drake]], [[Ellen DeGeneres]] and [[Walmart]], and the [[Tennessee Titans]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youcaring.com/victimsofhurricaneharvey-915053|title=Click here to support Houston Flood Relief Fund|website=YouCaring|language=en|access-date=2017-09-01}}</ref> *YoXMéxico. [[2017 Central Mexico earthquake]] struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with a magnitude estimated to be Mw 7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds. This fundraiser is for all of the victims of this earthquake and was initiated by Mexican soccer players [[Javier Hernández]] and [[Miguel Layún]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youcaring.com/lasvictimasdelterremotodemexico-956420|title=Click here to support Mexico's 2017 Earthquake Relief Fund|website=YouCaring|language=en|access-date=2017-09-20}}</ref> November 2017|accessdate=30 November 2017}}</ref> *Las Vegas-based artist Jska Priebe created a YouCaring page for her brother Michael Charter who was diagnosed with end-stage [[liver disease]].<ref
